verses.verse: He that is wounded in the stones <S%H6481><s%>, or has his privy member <S%H8212><s%> cut off <S%H3772><s%>, shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

A bastard <S%H4464><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; even to his tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall he not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

An Ammonite <S%H5984><s%> or Moabite <S%H4125><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; even to their tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall they not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> ever <S%H5769><s%>:

Because <S%H1697><s%> they met <S%H6923><s%> you not with bread <S%H3899><s%> and with water <S%H4325><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%>, when you came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>; and because they hired <S%H7936><s%> against you Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> of Pethor <S%H6604><s%> of Mesopotamia <S%H763><s%>, to curse you <S%H7043><s%>.

Nevertheless the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not listen <S%H8085><s%> unto Balaam <S%H1109><s%>; but the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> turned <S%H2015><s%> the curse <S%H7045><s%> into a blessing <S%H1293><s%> unto you <S%H3068><s%>, because the Lord your God <S%H430><s%> loved you <S%H157><s%>.
You shall not seek <S%H1875><s%> their peace <S%H7965><s%> nor their prosperity <S%H2896><s%> all your days <S%H3117><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>.

You shall not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Edomite <S%H130><s%>; for he is your brother <S%H251><s%>: you shall not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>; because you were a stranger <S%H1616><s%> in his land <S%H776><s%>.

The sons <S%H1121><s%> that are fathered <S%H3205><s%> of them shall enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> in their third <S%H7992><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%>.
When the host <S%H4264><s%> goes forth <S%H3318><s%> against your enemies <S%H341><s%>, then keep <S%H8104><s%> you from every wicked <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>.

If there be among you any man <S%H376><s%>, that is not clean <S%H2889><s%> by reason of uncleanness that chances <S%H7137><s%> him by night <S%H3915><s%>, then shall he go <S%H3318><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> out of the camp <S%H4264><s%>, he shall not come <S%H935><s%> inside <S%H8432><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>:

But it shall be <S%H6153><s%>, when evening comes on <S%H6437><s%>, he shall wash <S%H7364><s%> himself with water <S%H4325><s%>: and when the sun <S%H8121><s%> is down <S%H935><s%>, he shall come <S%H935><s%> into <S%H8432><s%> the camp again <S%H4264><s%>.
You shall have a place also <S%H3027><s%> outside <S%H2351><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>, where you shall go forth <S%H3318><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%>:

And you shall have a paddle <S%H3489><s%> among your weapons <S%H240><s%>; and it shall be <S%H3427><s%>, when you will ease yourself abroad <S%H2351><s%>, you shall dig <S%H2658><s%> with it <S%H7725><s%>, and shall turn back and cover <S%H3680><s%> that which comes from you <S%H6627><s%>:

For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of your camp <S%H4264><s%>, to deliver <S%H5337><s%> you <S%H5414><s%>, and to give up your enemies <S%H341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you <S%H4264><s%>; therefore shall your camp be holy <S%H6918><s%>: that he see <S%H7200><s%> no unclean <S%H6172><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> in you <S%H7725><s%>, and turn away from you <S%H310><s%>.
You shall not deliver <S%H5462><s%> unto his master <S%H113><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%> which is escaped <S%H5337><s%> from his master unto you <S%H113><s%>:

He shall live <S%H3427><s%> with you <S%H7130><s%>, even among you <S%H4725><s%>, in that place which he shall choose <S%H977><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of your gates <S%H8179><s%>, where it pleases him best <S%H2896><s%>: you shall not oppress him <S%H3238><s%>.
There shall be no whore <S%H6948><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, nor a sodomite <S%H6945><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

You shall not bring <S%H935><s%> the hire <S%H868><s%> of a whore <S%H2181><s%>, or the price <S%H4242><s%> of a dog <S%H3611><s%>, into the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> for any vow <S%H5088><s%>: for even both <S%H8147><s%> these are abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>.

You shall not lend upon usury <S%H5391><s%> to your brother <S%H251><s%>; usury <S%H5392><s%> of money <S%H3701><s%>, usury <S%H5392><s%> of food <S%H400><s%>, usury <S%H5392><s%> of any thing <S%H1697><s%> that is lent upon usury <S%H5391><s%>:

Unto a stranger <S%H5237><s%> you may lend upon usury <S%H5391><s%>; but unto your brother <S%H251><s%> you shall not lend upon usury <S%H5391><s%>: that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> you in all that you settest <S%H4916><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> to in the land <S%H776><s%> where you go <S%H935><s%> to possess it <S%H3423><s%>.

When you shall vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>, you shall not slack <S%H309><s%> to pay <S%H7999><s%> it <S%H3068><s%>: for the Lord your God <S%H430><s%> will surely <S%H1875><s%> require <S%H1875><s%> it of you <S%H2399><s%>; and it would be sin in you.
But if you shall forbear <S%H2308><s%> to vow <S%H5087><s%>, it shall be no sin in you <S%H2399><s%>.

That which is gone out <S%H4161><s%> of your lips <S%H8193><s%> you shall keep <S%H8104><s%> and perform <S%H6213><s%>; even a freewill offering <S%H5071><s%>, according as you have vowed <S%H5087><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>, which you have promised <S%H1696><s%> with your mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

When you come <S%H935><s%> into your neighbour <S%H7453><s%>'s vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, then you may eat <S%H398><s%> grapes <S%H6025><s%> your fill <S%H7648><s%> at your own pleasure <S%H5315><s%>; but you shall not put <S%H5414><s%> any in your vessel <S%H3627><s%>.

When you come <S%H935><s%> into the standing corn <S%H7054><s%> of your neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, then you may pluck <S%H6998><s%> the ears <S%H4425><s%> with your hand <S%H3027><s%>; but you shall not move <S%H5130><s%> a sickle <S%H2770><s%> unto your neighbour <S%H7453><s%>'s standing corn <S%H7054><s%>.
